site_title: Silvana’s Star Ball (My Version) By Wilson Lee

block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: Here at Heap Art, we are trying to inspire people to connect with each other through origami and paper folding. In this video I will show you how to fold my modified version of the the Silvana's Star Ball unit and show you how to assemble it. Silvana's Star Ball is a model composed of 30 modular units. Yes, it is modular origami. It is also known as a Kusudama Ball. I had some difficulty making a small version of the ball because the units do not want to stay together. This is why I modified the modular unit to have pockets for the connection. The pockets allowed me to make a small version of Silvana's Star Ball without using any glue or paperclips. I hope you like it. Thanks for watching. Here at Heap Art, we are trying to help you practice origami on a regular bases. Every week I will select a minimum of 2 origami models and show you how to fold it. If you like origami and paper airplanes -- Please use the following link to subscribe to my channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/heapart?sub_confirmation=1 My Upload Schedule: Tuesday : A new Paper Airplane, part of my 100 Exotic Paper Airplane Challenge Friday : A new Origami Model never seen before on my channel Thanks for watching! Wilson Lee @Heap Art
